query: Who are the tutorial chairs?

query: What is the main focus of the Industry Track of ACL 2023?
output: The main focus of the Industry Track of ACL 2023 is to highlight the key insights and new research challenges that arise from real-world implementations. It also welcomes opinion/vision papers related to real-world applications.

query: What is the purpose of the ACL2023 conference?
output: The purpose of the ACL2023 conference is to host the 61st Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics. It invites the submission of long and short papers featuring substantial, original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

query: What is the fee waiving policy for the tutorial presenters at the EACL 2023, ACL 2023, and EMNLP 2023 conferences?
output: The text only provides information about the fee waiving policy for the ACL 2023 conference, stating that up to 3 instructors per tutorial can have their registration fees waived for the main conference and any subset of co-located tutorials and workshops. There is no information provided for the EACL 2023 and EMNLP 2023 conferences.

query: How can I contact program chairs?
output: You can contact the program chairs at the following emails: acl2023-pc@googlegroups.com, jbg@umiacs.umd.edu, arog@itu.dk, and okazaki@c.titech.ac.jp.

query: How can I contact industry track chairs?
output: You can contact the industry track chairs at acl-2023-industry-track-pcs@googlegroups.com. Additionally, you can contact them individually at their email addresses: Beata Beigman Klebanov at bbeigmanklebanov@ets.org, Sunayana Sitaram at Sunayana.Sitaram@microsoft.com, and Jason Williams at jasondwilliams@gmail.com.

query: What is ACL student research workshop?
output: The ACL Student Research Workshop (SRW) is a forum organized under ACL 2023, offering an opportunity for students from diverse educational stages, like undergraduates, MSc/MA students, and junior and senior PhD students. The forum aims to help them in getting familiar with conducting and presenting their research in the fields of Computational Linguistics, Natural Language Processing, and Machine Learning. This workshop also provides a unique mentorship program, an opportunity to improve students' publication records, and encourages the submission of explorative studies.

query: What are the responsibilities of the organizers of the accepted proposals?
output: The organizers of the accepted proposals are responsible for publicizing and running the workshop, including reviewing submissions, producing the camera-ready workshop proceedings, organizing the meeting days, and ensuring all participants are aware of ACL’s anti-harassment policy. They must also commit to all deadlines, as failure to produce the camera-ready proceedings on time can lead to the exclusion of the workshop from the unified proceedings and author indexes. Additionally, they cannot accept submissions for publication that will be or have been published elsewhere. They are also in charge of staying on track with the timelines for the submission and reviewing of workshop papers and the preparation of camera-ready copies, which are different for each conference. Deviations from this schedule should only be done if necessary and with explicit agreement from the relevant Workshop Chairs.

query: What is Computational Linguistics?
output: Computational linguistics is the scientific study of language from a computational perspective. Computational linguists are interested in providing computational models of various kinds of linguistic phenomena. These models may be “knowledge-based” (“hand-crafted”) or “data-driven” (“statistical” or “empirical”). Work in computational linguistics is in some cases motivated from a scientific perspective in that one is trying to provide a computational explanation for a particular linguistic or psycholinguistic phenomenon; and in other cases the motivation may be more purely technological in that one wants to provide a working component of a speech or natural language system. The work of computational linguists is incorporated into many working systems today, including speech recognition systems, text-to-speech synthesizers, automated voice response systems, web search engines, text editors, language instruction materials, to name just a few.

query: What is the cancelation policy of regisration?
output: The cancellation policy for registration is as follows: registration cancelled one month or more prior to the conference, that is on June 09, 2023, or before, will be refunded the full amount paid, minus up to a $50 processing fee. Cancellations up to three weeks prior to the conference, which is on June 16, 2023, will only be refunded the ACL membership fee (if it was paid as part of the registration) and any amounts paid over $200. Cancellations made two weeks prior to the start of the conference, on June 23, 2023, as well as no-shows will not be refunded any amount, but they will retain the full year ACL membership (if it was paid as part of the registration) and have virtual access. Exceptions to these rules include cancellation due to governmental travel restrictions, failure to get a visa, or serious illness that prevents travel to the conference. In these cases, they will be refunded the full amount paid, reducing a $50 processing fee, regardless of when notification is received by the ACL Office. Documentation supporting the exception must be submitted.
